New Records: Matt Olson tied the Braves' single-season record for homers in a single season with 51 home runs
Post-Match Reflections: Olson said he made a conscious effort to dial back his hard swings and find a way to deliver the barrel more consistently
Miscellaneous Highlights: Olson has a big lead with 128 RBIs, 23 more than anyone else in either league
He's hitting.281 with a 1.007 OPS and is seven RBIs from matching Hall of Famer Eddie Mathews' 1953 franchise record of 135
Others: Olson has started every game this season at first base
The Braves retired Andruw Jones' No. 25 in a pregame ceremony Saturday
